title: Sections
description: Sections describe large areas of the page. Sections are `children` of an implied `.site` global class. This is to avoid having an overly generic class like `header` since that could be used as a `collection` class name where it is more appropriate to be less descriptive.

sections.title: Header
description: The header of the site. Styles should only affect the container and positioning of collections, items, or elements within.

sections.title: Footer
description: The footer of the site. Styles should only affect the container and positioning of collections, items, or elements within.

sections.title: Main
description: The main content of the site. Styles should only affect the container and positioning of collections, items, or elements within.

sections.title: Sidebar
description: The sidebar(s) of the site. Styles should only affect the container and positioning of collections, items, or elements within.

sections.title: Nav
description: The navigation(s) of the site. Styles should only affect the container and positioning of collections, items, or elements within. `nav` class is part of `03_collections/_listgroups.scss`, it is an example where the `nav` class has been left available for a collection to use.
